Line 29: Line 29:
* [[Brightidea]], founded in 1999, is a provider of social innovation management software. Its technology has been used by businesses and governmental institutions to power open innovation communities and contests. Examples include the 2010 [[General Electric]] Ecomagination Challenge seeking new technologies for the next generation power grid <ref>[http://www.ecomagination.com/ecomagination-challenge-powering-the-grid]</ref> as well as Cisco's first iPrize competition in 2007 <ref>[http://hbr.org/2009/09/inside-ciscos-search-for-the-next-big-idea/ar/1]</ref> and its first Russian iPrize challenge in 2010. <ref>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2JRZzWWdKB8</ref> <ref>https://sia.brightidea.com/skolkovo</ref>
* [[Brightidea]], founded in 1999, is a provider of social innovation management software. Its technology has been used by businesses and governmental institutions to power open innovation communities and contests. Examples include the 2010 [[General Electric]] Ecomagination Challenge seeking new technologies for the next generation power grid <ref>[http://www.ecomagination.com/ecomagination-challenge-powering-the-grid]</ref> as well as Cisco's first iPrize competition in 2007 <ref>[http://hbr.org/2009/09/inside-ciscos-search-for-the-next-big-idea/ar/1]</ref> and its first Russian iPrize challenge in 2010. <ref>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2JRZzWWdKB8</ref> <ref>https://sia.brightidea.com/skolkovo</ref>
* [[Spigit]], founded in 2007, is an innovation tools vendor which provides a platform that can be used to create open communities to capture, evaluate, contribute to, and select ideas for implementation. Examples of sponsoring organizations using Spigit are private organizations or businesses extending idea communities to customers or partners, or government agencies creating open communities to capture ideas from citizens.
* [[Spigit]], founded in 2007, is an innovation tools vendor which provides a platform that can be used to create open communities to capture, evaluate, contribute to, and select ideas for implementation. Examples of sponsoring organizations using Spigit are private organizations or businesses extending idea communities to customers or partners, or government agencies creating open communities to capture ideas from citizens.
â
* [[Texas Institute of Science (TxIS)]], founded in 2006, provides research and development augmentation services and intellectual property to clients in all industries through open innovation by utilizing the expertise of the [[TxIS Global Research Alliance]] ([[GRA]]) which consists of more than 15,000 professors and research scientists located throughout Eastern Europe and the former Soviet Union. Headquartered in Richardson, Texas, the company also has operations in several locations in Europe and Asia.
